intro: Psychotria mapourioides var. opaca, commonly known as the dark-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
